a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of population living on less than $3.65 per day vs. share in
The poverty line of $3.65 per day is set by the World Bank to be representative of the definitions of poverty adopted in
lower-middle-income countries. Multidimensional poverty is defined as being deprived in a range of health, education and
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024); Alkire, Kanagaratnam and Suppa (2024) - The Global
Note: Extreme poverty data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income
measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita. Multidimensional poverty is based on the most recent household
